title: 1. Thesis
stimulusHtml:
1 point
Has acceptable thesis.

• The thesis must accurately address and qualify change or continuity in beliefs or practices during the correct time period.

• The thesis does not have to contain specific dates but must accurately place the religions in the correct time periods.

• The thesis must be explicitly stated in the introduction or conclusion of the essay.

• The thesis may appear as one sentence or as multiple consecutive sentences, but it may not be split among multiple paragraphs.

• A thesis that merely restates the prompt is unacceptable.

• If the thesis is repeated/restated in the conclusion it may count for credit beyond the thesis.

• A statement that there were more changes than continuities does not constitute a thesis.

title: 2. Addresses Question
stimulusHtml:
2 points
Addresses all parts of the question, though not necessarily evenly or thoroughly.

For 2 points:

• Essay addresses with specificity both change and continuity in beliefs or practices within the time period.

For 1 point:

• Essay addresses with specificity either change or continuity in beliefs or practices within the time period.

title: 3. Historical Evidence
stimulusHtml:
2 points

Substantiates thesis with appropriate historical evidence.

For 2 points:

• Provides a minimum of four pieces of accurate evidence showing beliefs or practices within the time period. Evidence can come from change or continuity.

For 1 point:

• Provides a minimum of two pieces of accurate and specific evidence showing beliefs or practices within the time period. Evidence can come from change or continuity.

title: 4. Historical Context
stimulusHtml:
1 point
Uses relevant world historical context effectively to explain continuity and change over time.

• Essay accurately links world historical developments to changes or continuities in beliefs or practices.

title: 5. Analysis of Change
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Analyzes the process of continuity and/or change over time.

• Essay analyzes either change or continuity in beliefs or practices in the time period.

• Statement must be more than a discrete statement of evidence and must include a discussion of why the change or continuity occurred.

title: 6. Extended Core
stimulusHtml:
0-2 points
Expands beyond basic core of 1–7 points. The basic core score of 7 must be achieved before a student can earn expanded core points.

• Provides a clear, analytical, and comprehensive thesis.

• Analyzes all issues of the question (as relevant): world historical context, chronology, causation, change, continuity, effects, content.

• Analyzes all aspects of the question thoroughly – there is balance in the discussion

of change and continuity.

• Addresses all parts of the question evenly.

• Provides ample and accurate historical evidence to substantiate thesis.

• Provides links with relevant ideas, events, and trends in an innovative way.

• Provides a clear and concrete chronology of change.
